cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 125 miles SE of Cape Canaveral, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: continuing northwest tonight, then turning north-northwest Friday, skirting up the Florida east coast toward Georgia and South Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: very near the east-central Florida coast (around Cape Canaveral) with closest coastal passage along the Florida First Coast/Jacksonville area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Englewood to Anclote River (west-central Florida) under Tropical Storm Watch
weather_observation.warning_coast: Boca Raton, FL northward to South Santee River, SC (includes Jacksonville)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida east coast, Georgia coast, and South Carolina coast inside cone
weather_observation.wind: Potential for sustained tropical-storm to hurricane-force winds (50–90+ mph) beginning early Friday and lasting through Friday night
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 7–11 ft possible along the northeast Florida coast and into the lower St. Johns River near Jacksonville at times of high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches with isolated totals near 15 inches possible, leading to flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf, life-threatening rip currents, and isolated tornadoes in rain bands
